Package net.encrafted.plugin.spells.spells.utils

Class RayTraceUtils

java.lang.Object
net.encrafted.plugin.spells.spells.utils.RayTraceUtils
public class RayTraceUtils extends Object
The class that manages ray tracing and getting blocks/entities

    • rayTraceEntityNoPlayer

      public static org.bukkit.entity.Entity rayTraceEntityNoPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, double length, double bounds, boolean blockedByShield)
      Get an entity in the player looking direction, not including the player themselves
      Parameters:
      player - The player searching
      length - The total length of the ray
      bounds - The area around the ray to check at each position
      blockedByShield - If the ray can be blocked by a shield
      Returns:
      An entity if it's found, else null

    • getEntitiesInLineOfSight

      public static ArrayList<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> getEntitiesInLineOfSight(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity caster, double length, double bounds, @Nullable Predicate<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> filter, boolean blockedByShield)
      Get all entities in a player's line of sight
      Parameters:
      caster - The entity searching
      length - The total length of the ray
      bounds - The area around the ray to check at each position
      filter - Entities to filter out
      blockedByShield - If the ray can be blocked by a shield
      Returns:
      An arraylist of entities in the player's line of sight

    • rayTraceEntity

      public static org.bukkit.entity.Entity rayTraceEntity(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, double length, double bounds, Predicate<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> filter, boolean blockedByShield)
      Get an entity in the player looking direction
      Parameters:
      player - The player searching
      length - The total length of the ray
      bounds - The area around the ray to check at each position
      filter - Entities to filter out
      blockedByShield - If the ray can be blocked by a shield

    • getEntityInFront

      public static org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity getEntityInFront(org.bukkit.Location location, org.bukkit.util.Vector direction, double range, double dotBound, List<String> nameFilter)
      Get an entity in a cone in front of another entity
      Parameters:
      location - The location to start the check at
      direction - The direction to check in
      range - The range to check
      dotBound - The dot angle bound (1 = directly in front, 0 = anywhere in front, -1 = anywhere around)
      nameFilter - A list of entities to filter out based on their name
      Returns:
      The entity if found, else null

      public static org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity getProbableTarget(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, double length, double bounds, Predicate<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> filter)

      Parameters:
      player - The entity searching
      length - The total length of the ray
      bounds - The area around the ray to check at each position
      filter - Entities to filter out
      Returns:

    • getProbableTarget

      public static org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity getProbableTarget(org.bukkit.Location location, org.bukkit.util.Vector direction, double length, double bounds, Predicate<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> filter)
      Get the probable target of an entity by searching in it's looking direction
      Parameters:
      location - The location to search from
      direction - The direction to search in
      length - The total length of the ray
      bounds - The area around the ray to check at each position
      filter - Entities to filter out
      Returns:
      An entity if it's found, else null

      Check if there are no impassible blocks between two locations.
      Parameters:
      loc1 - The first location
      loc2 - The second location
      Returns:
      If the first location can see the second location

    • isInFront

      public static boolean isInFront(org.bukkit.Location location, org.bukkit.util.Vector direction, org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity, double bound)
      Check if an entity is in front of a location
      Parameters:
      location - The location
      direction - The direction which describes forward
      entity - The entity to check
      bound - The maximum bounds that defines in front (1 is directly in front, -1 is directly behind)
      Returns:
      If the entity is in front of the location

    • getClosestBlock

      public static org.bukkit.block.Block getClosestBlock(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, org.bukkit.util.Vector direction, int maxDistance)
      Get a closest block in a player direction
      Parameters:
      player - The player
      direction - The direction to search in
      maxDistance - The maximum distance to check
      Returns:
      The closest block, or null if it doesn't exist.

    • getBlockLocation

      public static org.bukkit.block.Block getBlockLocation(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, org.bukkit.util.Vector direction, int maxDistance, boolean blockedByShield, Predicate<org.bukkit.block.Block> blockFilter, boolean blockedByBarrier, boolean blockedByNotPassable)
      Get the block a player is looking at
      Parameters:
      player - The player
      direction - The direction to search in
      maxDistance - The maximum distance
      blockedByShield - If the ray is blocked by a shield
      blockFilter - Blocks to filter in (if true, you've found the block)
      blockedByBarrier - If the ray should be blocked by a barrier
      blockedByNotPassable - If the ray should be blocked by any block that is not passable
      Returns:
      The block, or null if none exists

    • isOnGround

      public static boolean isOnGround(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity player)
      Check if a player is on the ground
      Parameters:
      player - The player to check
      Returns:
      If the player is on the ground
